intro: Serruria hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy serruria, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Serruria hirsuta is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xerophytic gardens.
